column4: I just finished building a new system, and I'm trying to instll Feisty (Kubuntu).  I'm having problems with my bluetooth kb/mouse.  They worked during boot (to choose install, etc), but once it booted, If I press a key I get "KBlueToothD .... Not paired"
Feisty is still BETA software. It should not be used for production environments. Please address your question to #ubuntu+1.
Thanks.  I just saw no reason to go with 6.10 (or whatever) for a new system...if this will be out of beta within a month
Yeah. Feisty's official release data is really close :P
